snippet: Brooklyn Borough Hall is the only place in the United States where the public will be able to see the oldest documents that tell the story of St. Francis of Assisi.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes that newly-restored medieval manuscripts from the Sacred Convent of St Francis in Assisi will be displayed in only two places outside Italy: United Nations Headquarters in Manhattan and Brooklyn Borough Hall; display cases for Borough Hall exhibition are being made from recycled lumber by Red Hook furniture company Recycled Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: Brooklyn Borough Hall is the only place in the United States where the public will be able to see the oldest documents that tell the story of St. Francis of Assisi.

headline.main: St. Francis’ Papers, in Brooklyn, a Borough He’d Appreciate
headline.print_headline: St. Francis’ Papers, in a Borough He’d Appreciate
